1function isCreditCardValid(s) {
2
3 var i, n, c, r, t;
4
5 // First, reverse the string and remove any non-numeric characters.
6
7 r = "";
8 for (i = 0; i < s.length; i++) {
9 c = parseInt(s.charAt(i), 10);
10 if (c >= 0 && c <= 9)
11 r = c + r;
12 }
13
14 // Check for a bad string.
15
16 if (r.length < 16)
17 throw Error("Invalid credit card number");
18
19 // Now run through each single digit to create a new string. Even digits
20 // are multiplied by two, odd digits are left alone.
21
22 t = "";
23 for (i = 0; i < r.length; i++) {
24 c = parseInt(r.charAt(i), 10);
25 if (i % 2 != 0)
26 c *= 2;
27 t = t + c;
28 }
29
30 // Finally, add up all the single digits in this string.
31
32 n = 0;
33 for (i = 0; i < t.length; i++) {
34 c = parseInt(t.charAt(i), 10);
35 n = n + c;
36 }
37
38 // If the resulting sum is an even multiple of ten (but not zero), the
39 // card number is good.
40
41 if (n != 0 && n % 10 == 0)
42 return true;
43 else
44 return false;
45}
2.c:\sd\JsTestDemo\JsTestDemo.Jasmine.Tests\Tests\CreditCardTest.js
100 %
10/10
1/// <chutzpah_reference path="../../JsTestDemo/app/dashboard/creditcard.js" />
2
3describe("Credit Card number", function () {
4 it("should return true when valid", function () {
5 expect(isCreditCardValid("1234567890123452")).toEqual(true);
6
7 expect(isCreditCardValid("4627383674323741")).toEqual(true);
8
9 expect(isCreditCardValid("7238562784627463")).toEqual(true);
10 });
11
12 it("should return false when invalid", function () {
13 expect(isCreditCardValid("4723847238643764")).toEqual(false);
14 });
15
16 it("should throw exception when number is invalid", function () {
17 expect(function () {
18 isCreditCardValid("ABCDEFG");
19 }).toThrow(new Error("Invalid credit card number"));
20 });
21})
